verses.roman:
śrī-bhagavān uvāca
saptame hy adyatanād ūrdhvam
ahany etad arindama
nimaṅkṣyaty apyayāmbhodhau
trailokyaṁ bhūr-bhuvādikam

synonyms: śrī-bhagavān uvāca—the Supreme Personality of Godhead said; saptame—on the seventh; hi—indeed; adyatanāt—from today; ūrdhvam—forward; ahani—on the day; etat—this creation; arimdama—O King who can subdue your enemies; nimaṅkṣyati—shall be inundated; apyaya-ambhodhau—in the ocean of destruction; trailokyam—the three lokas; bhūḥ-bhuva-ādikam—namely Bhūrloka, Bhuvarloka and Svarloka.
translation: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: O King, who can subdue your enemies, on the seventh day from today the three worlds—Bhūḥ, Bhuvaḥ and Svaḥ—will all merge into the water of inundation.
